repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: A vocabulary of French words with their Tamil counterparts compiled, according to its title, by Beschi. Arranged according to French alphabetical order, from A to Z. Often documents entire Tamil phrases with a simple French meaning, such as idioms and expressions. Also documents Tamil word-phrases. Entry verbs are not lemmatized. Arabic numerals to mark page numbers are present, and each new letter is printed in large.
Manuscript complete, because entries upto ‘z’ are found, and the final page has a large empty space in it.
Description by Neela Bhaskar based on the digital images available on Gallica.

support.p: Same paper used in guard folios

extent.measure: {3} + 309 (u1 + U1). 3 front guard folios and 1 back guard folio (U2, f309).

supportDesc.foliation: Library added Arabic numerals on every recto of folio, on top right. Each new alphabet (i.e., chapter) represented in large. Quires of 8 pages numbered in Tamil numerals.

collation.desc: 3 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
3o9 folios = Dictionary, French-Tamil. Library Arabic foliation 1-309. Foliation 309 crossed-out. Folio 309 is back guard leaf.

layoutDesc.layout: Divided into chapters according to the French alphabet. French and Tamil counterpart separated by dotted line.

handNote.desc: Same hand for French and Tamil entries. Sporadic puḷḷi, but never for the final vowel in a grapheme.

additions.desc: In black ink: Mss. de Mr Sonnerat (front cover, verso).
BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 218 (front cover, verso).
Each new letter is printed in large.

binding.p: Leather binding, with paper as support material.

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1750 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-), to 1750 by Cabaton (1912), to the 18th century by James (2000), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
